theory.introduction: The `print()` function can do more than just show plain text. You can combine variables, add new lines, and format output cleanly.
theory.explanation: You can print multiple variables with commas, use `\n` for new lines, or use f-strings for clean formatting. F-strings are the modern way to embed variables into strings.
keyPoints: Use `print("Hello", name)` to print multiple items
Use `\n` to move to a new line
